Reviews.Title: “Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PedroBarrow
Reviews.Content: Very clean.The staff are very helpfull.Centrally located and I would go here again

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable views of the city”
Reviews.Author: GMR83Z
Reviews.Content: Like many other hotels in the area, BH Hotel has great views of Istanbul. The downside: the rooms are too small. Breakfast and staff are good which kinda makes up for the size of the rooms. The location is a huge advantage as the hotel can easily be used as a base for sightseeing around the city.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great - staff are excellent though”
Reviews.Author: silkcashmere
Reviews.Content: I read great reviews on trip advisor for this hotel so booked it but the first thing that you need to know is that the hotel has a name change - now called "Ferman Sultan hotel". This is important to note in case you book on online sites that still refer to it as "Blue Hills" as your cab driver may not know where to take you given that the hotel is off a narrow street in the Sultan Ahmet district and now only identifiable by it's new name on the exterior (next to the red chinese restaurant). The hotel's location is great - a short walk to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Armenian Cistern, Bazaar etc.. and the trams are a stone's throw away. It's also a 15-20min walk to the ferry terminals and the Galatasaray (?) bridge. The hotel rooms are a good size but I was kept on the ground floor and could hear everything at reception, including the annoying ambience music that plays non-stop during the day (and the track list is cyclical). Showers were not that hot, rooms were clean (relatively), the breakfast menu was repetitive and nothing extraordinary. There are many places in Istanbul to choose from, so apart from the great location and splendid customer service (front-desk staff who took pains to explain local attractions, handy tips to stave off the tourist traps etc.. and trip planning consultations) I probably would explore other options if only to see how they compare.

Reviews.Title: “Blue House Hotel Six Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spend six wonderful nights in this hotel. The staff could not have been any more helpful. The rooms are "european", comfy and very clean. The baths are typical of any hotel in England, small but functional. All major sights are right outside of the doorstep! We used it as home base while doing some heavy duty walking tours of the historical Istanbul area. We were very pleased, would certainly return. I cannot say enough about how nice the staff were, right down to the chamber maid who would not disturb our morning's late sleep-ins.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: gstar28
Reviews.Content: when we got to istanbul no taxi driver had ever heard of this hotel, its not called the blue hills hotel its called ferman sulthan, they changed their name about 3 times, the staff are rude and you have to pester them to have anything done, they stuck me in the room outside of the reception and the night staff were laughing and talking outside the room all night, the heating didnt work and I had to beg for a duvet, which was useless, when I asked for a room change the reception said I needed to talk to someone else, no surprise that guy never made an appearance on our holiday, the breakfast was not nice at all, it was ruinbed in many ways, milk that was not cold, omellete will big salami pieces in, ridiculous, we ended up travelling around turkey to avoid staying here, its a JOKE ESTABLISHMENT!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best location and very helpful staffs”
Reviews.Author: JaneJ2010
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at Blue Hills Hotel, which has an excellent location - very short walking distance to Hippodrome, famous Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. There are convenient store, restaurant cafe cross the hotel and a delicious Chinese restaurant around the corner. It takes about 20-minute walking distance to Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar and Galato Bridge as well as to Cemberlitas Hamami (ancient Turkish bath). Hotel has a small lift but rooms are spacey for both 2 beds and single king bed (I have stayed in both), clean with firm bed and it provides the basic toiletries. Internet is free. Buffet style breakfast served on the rooftop patio with both European and Turkish treats; from rooftop you have beautiful view, especially at sunrise and sunset, of Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara. Above all the merits, hotel has very friendly staffs, they are eager to assist at your request at anytime.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: ahmad_abed
Reviews.Content: blue hills hotel , it was an amazing hotel i ever been in turky , start with recebtion gay mustafa he help me a lot with so many thing , in my first travel to turky and istanbul i don't know any thing so my brother mustafa help me with a lot of tours locations and book it for me and my friend with so esay and comfortable , with room serves there is so Respect and privacy . i love blue hills hotel so much of course if i visit istnbul agine blue hills hotel will be my choice :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mohsin8481952
Reviews.Content: Room was large and comfortable as it was well equipped with all immenities.the, staff was friendly and very helpful.All major sightseeing was at a very comfortable walking distance.breakfast was very simple but Iso was helpful and efficient .Hot water in the shower was an issue in the last two days.Overall it was good value and I enjoyed my stay.thank you once again.

Reviews.Title: “reasonabul but...”
Reviews.Author: bossaTokyo
Reviews.Content: There are lots of other reasonable and fancy hotels around this. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “Avery good choÄ±ce”
Reviews.Author: mvdorofeykova
Reviews.Content: The qualÄ±ty of servÄ±ce was Very Good, specÄ±al thanks to Iso, the manager! InterÄ±ors are very nÄ±ce, a good vÄ±ew from a terrace. LocatÄ±ons's just excellent. The stuff dÄ±d everythÄ±ng to help and solved problems professÄ±onally!:)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally helpful and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Alonestone
Reviews.Content: Although this was booked via a travel agent I was quite happy with the accomodations. After travelling all around Turkey I realized it was a higher end hotel than what I thought the first nights I stayed there. I was a little chilly in the room the first night- to which staff responded immediately to assist. The Breakfast was the best- beautifully presented. To see Ishmael's beautiful smile each morning up on the roof top patio above Istanbul serving fresh cheese and local honey made the whole trip! A lovely restaurant across the street made it easy to explore all day- and stay close to home (if one wants to) at night. Very kind and very helpful staff. For a woman travelling alone- a very safe feeling and very helpful team to assist in getting you a car or driver, or directions to anyplace in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Yes A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShellInverloch
Reviews.Content: We loved the staff (although at the end of our stay the owners allegedly were moving in their family staff and outing the staff we experienced??). Rooms were what you talk about when you get home! Our first room was basement so we had a sky light view of the footpath! But this was fun and nothing we had experienced before. Some bathroom facilities were a bit intermittent but fine. The best breakfast ever experienced anywhere- Local food (yoghurt fruit olives tomatoes etc) plus anything else you could possibly want served on the roof top with great views and friendly staff. Best location - in the heart of it all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: piciex
Reviews.Content: The Blue Hills Hotel is just wonderful. The location is great, within a minute walk from the main attractions of the city. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The service was just perfect. Everyone was friendly and helpful especially the "Breakfast man" ( greetings for him). To sum up, the hotel deserves to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, lovely staff, central location”
Reviews.Author: Celenab
Reviews.Content: Blue Hills Hotel was a very good place to stay in Istanbul. Staff was friendly, kind, helpful, considerate, and seemed to truly love their jobs and meeting travellers. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Every amenity was provided, although the room decor was the charming attempt at 'luxury' seen in hotels in countries that are still coming into their own. Breakfast was a delicious buffet of both European and Turkish treats. Location was perfect - walking distance to every important site.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: twovals
Reviews.Content: This small hotel offers no appearance from the street but the location is next to the Hippodrome near the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. The rooms are clean and adequate..The staff is very helpful . From the breakfast terrace you see the Blue Mosque and the Marmara sea..Above this is another terrace with a great view while having a drink. watching the sun comes down..Try to get the room on the upper floor adjacent to the breakfast terrace.. Right accross is a small restaurant very convenient..the name is Sokullu...

Reviews.Title: “small, friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: palmerstl
Reviews.Content: We found the location of this hotel to be very desirable for walking to many attractions. The staff were very friendly and always offering to assist with whatever we needed The rooms were very clean and we enjoyed the smallness of the hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet area but close to the major sights”
Reviews.Author: margaretbold
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the hotel and found it very comfortable with an excellent breakfast provided by Iso. The room was a good size and the large comfy bed ensured a good nights sleep. When we arrived close to midnight, we were not too sure about the area but it proved to be ideal - right in the middle of Sultanahmet old town but in a quiet area and only a short walk from the Blue Mosque etc. and the tram stop. Generally the staff were very helpful, in particular Hamdi who was really interested in helping his guests get a wider view of Istanbul rather than just the immediate tourist area. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndigoDuck
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed initially as this hotel is listed as a 4 star on TripAdvisor, which it is most definitely not, and may not be worth the extra money. In short: The good: * Location - even if you don't stay at this hotel, stay in the Sultanahmet area from which you can walk to most major sites and tram to other. It's the central tourist hub which is convenient to stay in * They let you use their laptop in the hotel lobby to surf the net. Unfortunately, you have to navigate a foreign keyboard which take a little getting used to. Bring a wi-fi enabled phone instead if you can. * Rooms are clean although there was a musty odor when we checked in. Rooms are as pictured on TripAdvisor. Noise was not an issue when we stayed there. * Roof-top buffet breakfast was fine and the views were great. Not sure what they do in the winter time. The bad: * Depending on which staff member you spoke to, you may get biased advice that will help them earn commissions on airport transfers, tours, and other services. * Definitely not a 4 star hotel as advertised on TripAdvisor Suggestions: * Try booking through the hotel website for a better deal * Try to negotiate for a free hotel pick up BEFORE you book. Otherwise, they offer to give you one for EUR 30 which is double of what you can generally find around town. Don't try finding this place on your own when landing in Istanbul cuz the streets can be confusing at first. * The Lady Diana hotel which is a block away seemed like a much better hotel and some of our friends got a room there at a much lower rate (maybe cuz they were part of a large tour group). Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate and don't need something 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: pgossman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located with in easy walking distance of all the major attractions of Istanbul and on a quiet, cobble stone street. Across the street is a good restaurant and a coffee/bookshop with good customer service. The hotel manager went out of his way to accommodate our group--storing extra luggage while on excursions, arranging transportation. Really nice staff. Breakfast was on the roof top with a nice food selection and overlooking the Blue Mosque. The value was very good given the personal attention and great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Blue Hills Hotel was our "home" in Istambul.”
Reviews.Author: kwiley2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently had the pleasure of visiting Turkey. The Blue Hills Hotel, located in the Sultanahmet area of Istambul, was our "home base". The hotel is within walking distance of many of the "must-see" sites of historic Istambul, and also near tram stops, restaurants, and shopping areas. The hotel's staff is unfailingly helpful and friendly, making us feel safe and "looked after" during our stay. A generous and delicious complimentary breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace with view of the Bosphorus. We highly recommend the Blue Hills Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Cozy Refuge From The Busy Streets Of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Winslow25
Reviews.Content: I would say that the terrace and rooftop views of the Marmara and the Blue Mosque are my favorite things about the Blue Hills Hotel, but they're secondary to the hospitality I received, even as a student, from the hotel staff. Perhaps I'm easy to please, but I don't have one serious complaint about the duration of my stay here - minor complaints are that the internet was a bit touch and go and there was no fitness center. I actually plan to return to Istanbul with my parents upon my graduation, and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very comforable, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: pinkie30
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here by accident as the ash cloud problem meant we could not fly home on the expected day. We were staying at hotel Divas down the street but they were fully booked. This was a much nicer hotel. We were sorry we had not booked for our full time in Istanbul. Lovely big room. Good breakfast on rooftop with lovely views. Free wifi also. Great location too. would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Anything is possible!”
Reviews.Author: elissabrooksart
Reviews.Content: The manager of this hotel, Bulent was a wonderful help to myself and my friends. He keeps this hotel spotless and his staff is wonderful. The morning manager Varol was a life saver this trip. He goes far beyond the call of duty to help the customers. I enjoyed my stay so much because of the wonderful staff here at the Blue Hills Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “" Home in Turkey"”
Reviews.Author: LinAriel
Reviews.Content: The management of this facility is outstanding. I brought a group of university students and Mr. Bulent Sayan and his morning manager Varol Gunac made sure that our stay went smoothly. Hotel service was excellent, hotel staff professional and friendly. I could not have made a better choice. L. Hightower

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodation in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gautam269
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Hills Hotel for 4 nights in the first week of May. Our trip to Istanbul was great and we felt quite at home at the hotel. We contacted Brittany Wade of the Hotel's Management directly and got a decent rate for a double bed. The hotel also arranged for transport from Sabiha Airport (though ofcourse at a cost but they do offer free transport from Ataturk Airport). Our room which was located on the 3rd floor was nice with a comfortable bed, a sofa and a flat screen TV. The room seemed a bit small in the beginning but then we kind of got used to it. The bathroom was rather small though the shower area was a decent size. There was a peculiar smell in the bathroom when we checked in and we realized that the dustbin was quite loaded with rather unpleasant things left behind by the previous occupants and overlooked by the cleaner. However, it was cleaned the next day. The sheets on the bed were clean but the pillow cover and bedcover did have a few stains. To add to that, a pigeon flew into our room (our mistake actually since we left a window open) and created quite a riot. But no complaints since the sheets were promptly replaced the next day. The breakfast is on the roof which has a lovely view of the Blue Mosque on one side and the sea the other. The breakfast is standard Turkish food with some fruits, lots of jams, cheese, butter, boiled eggs, fresh bread etc etc. But we are a bit fussy when it comes to breakfast and after 2 days, we wanted to eat something different but then mornings is not the best time to venture out looking for an ideal breakfast so we settled for whatever was offered. Mind you the food was definitely nice; it was just the monotony of having the same grub every morning. The staff is very polite and guide quite well. Language was a bit of a problem with the lady assisting in the morning breakfast and the cleaner but the reception staff was fluent in English so no issues there. One very good offering by the Hotel is a free wifi in the room, which I though was great since most hotels would charge for a similar service. And the internet connection was fast. There is also a laptop available at the reception if one is not carrying their own computer. I would like to thank the hotel staff for making our stay at the Blue Hills a comfortable one and we would definitely consider going back to the hotel if we were to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful servÄ±ce Ä±n a beautÄ±ful town”
Reviews.Author: TahoeLife
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were wonderful! Anything that we need Ä±n our room or Ä±nformatÄ±on about the town was provÄ±ded with a smÄ±le. The location was perfect for walkÄ±ng around the city all day and relaxÄ±ng at night on the roof with a 6 pack of beer and beautiful vÄ±ews.The breakfast every mornÄ±ng on the roof top cafe was delÄ±ghtful and well stocked wÄ±th many dÄ±fferent choÄ±ces. We had the famÄ±ly suÄ±te room that was very well maÄ±ntaÄ±ned wÄ±th lively street vÄ±ews. We lÄ±ked Ä±t so much that when we return to Istanbul at the end of our trip we are stayÄ±ng here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation and good service”
Reviews.Author: Syed786
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Blue Hills Hotel for 9 days. The hoteal was situated in an ideal place for us. We could walk to all the important historical sites and still be in our hotel for rest within 5 minutes. The staff were very curteous and well presented. We would certainly recommend anyone to stay and enjoy the delights of Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “would go back!”
Reviews.Author: dxbsheikha
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the triple room with our 9 yr old and our toddler. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom had a jacuzzi type bath with a shower. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. They were particularly helpful with our toddler especially while we were eating breakfast! Breakfast was good with types of cheese, salami, eggs etc. The view from the roof where we ate breakfast was stunning. There is a good restaurant across the road with very nice staff too, and the food there is good! The hotel is within walking distance to Blue Mosque, the hamam, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, museums so very convenient. There is a free airport transfer to Ataturk if you stay 3 nights or more, just make sure you confirm this a day in advance. We will DEFINITELY go back there and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Very Friendly & Helpful Staff. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shanni10
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via a 3rd party site (tobook.com) for 600 Euros for 7 nights - a bargain considering it was Easter. We were meant to arrive on Wednesday 31st March, but due to complications we had to catch a flight the next day. I informed the manager (via email,) Varol that we couldnt make it to the airport for wednesday evening, and he happily changed the pickup to thursday. Arrived at the airport, 3 hours late, the pickup company (Backpackers ) were waiting patiently for us. We arrived at the hotel within 20 minutes and the night duty assistant showed to us our room. The room was decent but had a lingering smell of cigarette smoke, probably from previous tenant. In the morning, Varol the Manager, with no fuss upgraded our room to the Suite. All our belongings were moved by the staff, when we went out for our tour of the city. The Suite was lovely, spacious and perfect for our family. The hotel is virtually minutes away from the Blue Mosque, you simply come out of the hotel, go left then turn right. Within 3 minutes you will be at the hippodrome area where the blue mosque is. Throughout our time there, the staff were fantastic, although the maid does not speak english, she was very friendly and helpful. We got a lot of help from Ismail, who also works there. My 3 year old son took a great liking to him. Chihan (evening duty) and Varol were extremely helpful in planning our outings and showed us on the map where to go. They even booked events on behalf of the customers, which was great. We had breakfast on the roof when it was sunny (4 days out of 6) which was fantastic. Breakfast was decent, and they even allowed us to have breakfast after the 10.30am deadline. For long trips and for our journey back to the airport, we used Backpackers (got the details from http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com/tourop/bakpak/index.html). They are pretty much the same price as a taxi, but much better service and you get to go in comfort in a large mercedes van. If you need to go for long journeys, I advise to use them. They are fantastic and were always prompt. I will hopefully try to write a review of Istanbul on this site, especially for family with a small child. Just one word of advice, if you want to do your shopping, dont buy from the Grand Bazaar, unless you are one heck of a barterer. Best place is the Spice Bazaar or even local supermarkets. So to summarise, lovely hotel, perfect location with great staff. For a family or couple, it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money and great service”
Reviews.Author: BackpackerNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Great value for money - good breakfast that is included, free internet (wireless and a computer downstairs) and spacious rooms. The suite has a view of the water and they have just finished the breakfast room upstairs which will have views of the Blue Mosque and surrounding area. There is a small bar fridge and tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. Staff were extremely friendly, accomodating and always available. They can speak English which makes things easier. We stayed for a week and really enjoyed it. The hotel is very central to the old part of Istanbul - Blue Mosque etc and close to public transport - the tram is less than a five minute walk from the hotel and it is very easy to catch this (with a change from the metro) from the airport. There are also two supermarkets close by (about 3 mins walk - turn left out of the hotel and left again) which are handy when you are staying for a while. There is also a great kebab place called Ortaklar on the intersection of the same road which is delicious and inexpensive For elderly / disabled people, be aware that the bathtub is high and a bit awkward to climb into (the shower is over the bath) - so ask about this when booking. We are definitely glad that we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Babsthe49er
Reviews.Content: We were part of a group that stayed there, first at the beginning of our trip and then at the end. As a result, I don't know what the rate was per night. The rooms were spotless and the staff was extremely helpful. The staff spoke excellent English. I would strongly recommend staying there when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulCapeMay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at this hotel during our stay in Istanbul. The hotel is in an excellent location, about a 5-7 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia. The actual street that the hotel is located on is pretty dead but you can easily walk to the nearby restaurants and bars. The service is also excellent. The staff quickly learned our names and helped us with restaurant recommendations and other information. Notably, on one evening my husband had to go to the hospital because he had a fever and the staff person make several calls and hailed a taxi to take us to the medical clinic. We were very impressed by their responsiveness. The roof terrace has a beautiful view of the city. Unfortunately, it was under construction while we were there and breakfast was served downstairs instead. However, once the terrace is up and running again, I think it would be an ideal place to have breakfast. The only reason why I am giving this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because it advertises itself as a non-smoking hotel. However, there were ashtrays in every room and there was definitely some smoking going on in other rooms near us, which bothered us. I would definitely stay here again but would love it if the hotel were entirely non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “terrific Choice”
Reviews.Author: LisainChiTown
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful with every request I had. Laundry, forgotten items at previous hotel, directions, etc. Lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great historical peninsula!..”
Reviews.Author: beowulf_aviator
Reviews.Content: Primarily,l was very happy to accomodated in Blue Hills Hotel.Wonderfull breakfast(l had a breakfast like a sultans ),clean rooms, friendly and helpfull staff.Hotel is in the center of historical peninsula(old city).Location is incredible.it is close to all historical places by walk.l like istanbul very much.hotel is look like heaven when l entered to room.huge bathroom,nice jacuzzi,well AC.then terrace of hotel wonderfull.so nice view of marmara sea and princess islands.l recommend to everybody visit istanbul and to stay this hotel.l am sure everybody write nice comments on tripadvisor for blue hills hotel and great city istanbul.l hope l will visit istanbul and stay same hotel one day.thnx for everything Blue Hills.;))))))))))

Reviews.Title: “Blue HÄ±lls - your home Ä±n Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bluesq1
Reviews.Content: CharmÄ±ng lÄ±ttle hotel located rÄ±ght Ä±n the center of the old cÄ±ty. Short walk from the Blue Mosque. I hÄ±ghly recommend chosÄ±ng thÄ±s hotel. The staff Ä±s very frÄ±endly, cheerful and extremelly helpful. You wÄ±ll feel rÄ±ght at home here. And do not mÄ±ss theÄ±r delÄ±cÄ±ous breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - great location, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: pshield1
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better - within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace among other sites. The staff was terrific was great suggestions and attentive to all our needs, extended themselves above and beyond anything we could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “the best choice”
Reviews.Author: dall82
Reviews.Content: we have made a reservation after read all reviews on trip advisor. We have booked two double rooms. Hotel staff arranged a shuttle bus for us to pick us up from the airport. When we arrived to hotel we felt ourself as if in a heaven. The rooms were very clean. Bathrooms were quite big, ac was working very well ( this is the most important thing for everybody) Front of desk very polite helpful they were always smiling. Hotel' location was perfect very close to hippodrome, blue mosque, hagia sophia, topkapi palace, grand bazaar... but as you are walking on the street you can see many people who try to sell carpet you should avoid them. Breakfast was very good. Bosphourus tour must be done. We would reccomend this very nice hotel to our all friends...

Reviews.Title: “location, staff, good price...”
Reviews.Author: clst_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in blue hills hotel with my family 3 nights. We booked a suite room which has a sea view for 4 people. The room was very clean also there was a jacuzzi and bathroom was very big. This room was one of the biggest room that we have stayed in many hotels. The staff were amazing, very helpful. Location was perfect. In general very nice hotel, nice staff, perfect location, reasonable price.. we will come back...

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay!!! Staff is Second to none!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheldawn
Reviews.Content: Troy - Washington DC Fantastic Location to all sites in the old city. Customer service, as stated was second to none. The staff was very accommodating and did everything in their power to make our stay enjoyable. Usually spending the first few days of an overseas trip with your luggage being lost by the airlines, starts you off on the wrong foot. The staff here made us very comfortable. They called repeatedly for our luggage, called us while we were out when the luggage finally arrived, and in the interim, personally walked us to the store to get some toiletries. just before our trip to Bodrum, they held our luggage for a few days with no questions asked. We were greeted with any drink we wished to have, and it was brought to our rooms, and unlike anywhere we've been, the all items in the minibar are complimentary!!! The room was very comfortable and the bed was like sleepy in our own. When we return to Istanbul, this is the place we will stay. Customer service goes a long way to us, and we are convinced that if you visit, this is where you will want to be too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: pelerine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Hills for 4 nights. The reception staff was new but they were friendly and spoke English well. The rooms were clean and big enough for two. Breakfast was included and was served, buffet style, in a breakfast room. Use of a computer in that room was free. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood about 3 blocks from the Hippodrome and it was very easy to walk to the major attractions such as the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Grand Bazaar. This is not a fancy or luxurious place, but is for travelers who want a basic, clean hotel with local flavor at a reasonable price. There is a restaurant across the street serving good local favorites for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and staff can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: crosswycke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Blue Hills for two nights at the beginning of my trip and one night at the end. I can't say enough about the helpful, friendly staff and the great location of the hotel. The location is a short walk from many of the main tourist sights such as Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the Basilica Cistern. And the tram station is also close by. No matter what I asked the staff, they were very helpful and accomodating. As far as the rooms - I stayed in what felt like a tiny, dark cell on the ground floor my first two nights and barely had room for my suitcase. However, it was clean and had plenty of hot water. The last night, however, I stayed in room 102 - a spacious, bright, cheery room. Don't expect top luxury and you won't be disappointed. The breakfast was a buffet that had many things to choose from - all fresh and appetizing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you blue hills”
Reviews.Author: moskowpav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the blue hills hotel with my wife for 3 days at the begining of june. location was perfect we walked topkapi palace hagia sophia in a few minutes. our room was ok. the staff were friendly and welcoming, the breakfast was great ( water melon some cakes cheese fresh yoghurt...) the price was quite reasonable. my only dissapointment was there was a renovation on the roof top/ terrace so we could not drink something as we were sitting there but there was a very nice view wit blue mosque and the bosphorous. I would reccomend this hotel to my friends. bye blue hills see you:D

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DinDC08
Reviews.Content: The first night I was somewhat saddened by the room. The pictures posted on the Blue Hills site are not a percise dipiction of what you will find if you just book the standard room. However, the staff, and their wonderful service more than made up for the disappointment. The staff was WONDERFUL! Lovely people and would go back just to say hello and be with them. The location of the hotel is in a very old part of Istanbul, but within walking distance to everything. All of the hotels in this part of the city are small, but renovated and very affordable. I would try to book one of the suites if possible to make the stay more pleasurable, but as said before the staff makes this a wonderful place to stay. Visiting Istanbul one is rarely in their room but to shower and sleep anyway and this is a lovely, ease to get to everywhere hotel.

Reviews.Title: “truly,a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sid93Muscat
Reviews.Content: we stayed at blue hills for 5 nights.located less than a stone's throw frm the hippodrome,this nice little boutique hotel has a very homely feel to it.we had prebooked 2 double rooms adjacent to each other.the rooms were very nicely done up,with very comfortable beds,well-stockehad prebooked 2 double rooms adjacent to each other.d minibar,TV,safe and wardrobe.the bathrooms were nicely done,with marble sinks and plenty of towels and a hairdryer.the service was just great,and they had given us an electric kettle and a little tea set for our room too.the staff were very friendly,spoke fluent english,and were always ready to help,at all hours.the breakfast spread was simple,filling and delicious.they served fresh,delicious honeycomb each morning,along with fresh fruits and vegetables.there was also a nice bbq restaurant just across the street from the hotel.the terrace made for a great view of the sultanahmet district and the sea.all this,for a very low price,made it an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small, boutique hotel in excellent location with charming hosts”
Reviews.Author: susanhannah2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small hotel in the heart of the old city of Istanbul, the Blue Hills is a great choice. We stayed at the beginning of our two week tour of the country and when we came back we were greeted like old friends. They were gracious and caring and we enjoyed the "typical" local breakfast with the gracious "breakfast manager" who kept things plentiful and fresh daily. Walking distance to all the important sites, not fancy, but just what we wanted in a reasonable, local type of experience.
